get.description: Get all calendar groups in a location.

post.description: Validate if group slug is available or not.

parameters.name: userId
parameters.description: User Id - Owner of an appointment. Either of userId, groupId or calendarId is required

parameters.name: calendarId
parameters.description: Either of calendarId, userId or groupId is required

parameters.name: groupId
parameters.description: Either of groupId, calendarId or userId is required

parameters.name: userId
parameters.description: User Id - Owner of an appointment. Either of userId, groupId or calendarId is required

parameters.name: calendarId
parameters.description: Either of calendarId, userId or groupId is required

parameters.name: groupId
parameters.description: Either of groupId, calendarId or userId is required

get.description: Get free slots for a calendar between a date range. Optionally a consumer can also request free slots in a particular timezone and also for a particular user.

parameters.name: timezone
parameters.description: The timezone in which the free slots are returned

parameters.name: userId
parameters.description: The user for whom the free slots are returned

parameters.name: userIds
parameters.description: The users for whom the free slots are returned

parameters.name: eventId
parameters.description: Event Id or Instance id. For recurring appointments send masterEventId to modify original series.

parameters.name: eventId
parameters.description: Event Id or Instance id. For recurring appointments send masterEventId to modify original series.

parameters.name: eventId
parameters.description: Event Id or Instance id. For recurring appointments send masterEventId to modify original series.

get.description: List calendar resources by resource type and location ID

post.description: Create calendar resource by resource type

get.description: Get calendar notifications based on query

parameters.name: altType
parameters.description: Specifies the model associated with the notification. This can be extended to support additional models in the future. For now only Calendars is supported

parameters.name: altId
parameters.description: Specifies the ID of the model associated with the notification. This can be extended to support additional models in the future.

post.description: Create Calendar notifications, either one or multiple. All notification settings must be for single calendar only

get.description: Get all calendars in a location.

bearer.name: Authorization
bearer.description: Use the Access Token generated with user type as Sub-Account (OR) Private Integration Token of Sub-Account.

Location-Access.name: Authorization
Location-Access.description: Use the Access Token generated with user type as Sub-Account (OR) Private Integration Token of Sub-Account.

Agency-Access.name: Authorization
Agency-Access.description: Use the Access Token generated with user type as Agency (OR) Private Integration Token of Agency.

message.example: Invalid token: access token is invalid

meetingLocationType.description:
Meeting location type. 
- If `address` is provided in the request body, the `meetingLocationType` defaults to **custom**.

meetingLocationId.description:
The unique identifier for the meeting location.
- This value can be found in `calendar.locationConfigurations`or `calendar.teamMembers[].locationConfigurations`

overrideLocationConfig.description:
Flag to override location config
- **false** - If only `meetingLocationId` is provided
- **true** - If only `meetingLocationType` is provided

ignoreDateRange.description: If set to true, the minimum scheduling notice and date range would be ignored

toNotify.description: If set to false, the automations will not run

ignoreFreeSlotValidation.description: If true the time slot validation would be avoided for any appointment creation (even the ignoreDateRange)

rrule.description: RRULE as per the iCalendar (RFC 5545) specification for recurring events. DTSTART is not required, instance ids are calculated on the basis of startTime of the event. The rrule only be applied if ignoreFreeSlotValidation is true.

isRecurring.description: true if the event is recurring otherwise false

rrule.description: RRULE as per the iCalendar (RFC 5545) specification for recurring events

meetingLocationType.description:
Meeting location type. 
- If `address` is provided in the request body, the `meetingLocationType` defaults to **custom**.

meetingLocationId.description:
The unique identifier for the meeting location.
- This value can be found in `calendar.locationConfigurations`or `calendar.teamMembers[].locationConfigurations`

overrideLocationConfig.description:
Flag to override location config
- **false** - If only `meetingLocationId` is provided
- **true** - If only `meetingLocationType` is provided

ignoreDateRange.description: If set to true, the minimum scheduling notice and date range would be ignored

toNotify.description: If set to false, the automations will not run

ignoreFreeSlotValidation.description: If true the time slot validation would be avoided for any appointment creation (even the ignoreDateRange)

rrule.description: RRULE as per the iCalendar (RFC 5545) specification for recurring events. DTSTART is not required, instance ids are calculated on the basis of startTime of the event. The rrule only be applied if ignoreFreeSlotValidation is true.

userId.description: The ID of the user who created or updated the appointment

id.description: Event Id or Instance id for a recurring event

assignedUserId.description: AssignedUser - the primary owner of an appointment

users.description: Users - the secondary owners of an appointment.

isRecurring.description: true if the event is recurring otherwise false

rrule.description: RRULE as per the iCalendar (RFC 5545) specification for recurring events. DTSTART is not required, instance ids are calculated on the basis of startTime of the event.

assignedResources.description: Ids of associated resources rooms and/or equipments

masterEventId.description: Master event id for a recurring instance

kind.description: Type of meeting location. zoom_conference/google_conference/ms_teams_conference is not supported in event calendar type

location.description: Address for meeting location. Not applicable on "zoom_conference", "google_conference" and "ms_teams_conference" kind

isPrimary.description: Marks a user as primary. This property is required in case of collective booking calendars. Only one user can be primary.

locationConfigurations.description:
Meeting location configuration for event calendar.
- *Multiple locations are allowed only when one team member is selected.*
- *For **Class booking** and **Collective** calendars, only one location configuration is allowed for each team member.*

bookingOption.description: This setting contols what to do incase a recurring slot is unavailable

bookingOverlapDefaultStatus.description: This setting contols what to do incase a recurring slot is unavailable

date.description: Formulate the date string in the format of `<YYYY-MM-DD in local timezone>T00:00:00.000Z`.

LookBusyPercentage.description: Percentage of slots that will be hidden

isActive.description: Should the created calendar be active or draft

notifications.description: Deprecated! Please use 'Calendar Notifications APIs' instead.

teamMembers.description: Team members are required for calendars of type: Round Robin, Collective, Class, Service.

widgetType.description: Calendar widget type. Choose "default" for "neo" and "classic" for "classic" layout.

locationConfigurations.description: Meeting location configuration for event calendar

slotDuration.description: This controls the duration of the meeting

slotInterval.description: Slot interval reflects the amount of time the between booking slots that will be shown in the calendar.

slotBuffer.description: Slot-Buffer is additional time that can be added after an appointment, allowing for extra time to wrap up

preBuffer.description: Pre-Buffer is additional time that can be added before an appointment, allowing for extra time to get ready

appoinmentPerSlot.description: Maximum bookings per slot (per user). Maximum seats per slot in case of Class Booking Calendar.

appoinmentPerDay.description: Number of appointments that can be booked for a given day

allowBookingFor.description: Minimum number of days/weeks/months for which to allow booking events

allowBookingForUnit.description: Unit for controlling the duration for which booking would be allowed for

openHours.description: This is only to set the standard availability. For custom availability, use the availabilities property

enableRecurring.description: Enable recurring appointments for the calendars. Please note that only one member should be added in the calendar to enable this

availabilityType.description:
Determines which availability type to consider:
- **1**: Only custom availabilities will be used.
- **0**: Only open hours will be used.
- **null**: Both custom availabilities and open hours will be considered.

availabilities.description: This is only to set the custom availability. For standard availability, use the openHours property

location.description: Address for meeting location. Not applicable on "zoom_conference", "google_conference" and "ms_teams_conference" kind

meetingId.description: Unique ID used to select a specific meeting location

isPrimary.description: Marks a user as primary. This property is required in case of collective booking calendars. Only one user can be primary.

isActive.description: Should the created calendar be active or draft

calendarId.description: Calendar Id (Block Slot can only be created on simple/event calendars)

outOfService.description: Indicates if the resource is out of service
Quantity of the out of service equipment.

calendarIds.description:
Service calendar IDs to be mapped with the resource.

    One equipment can only be mapped with one service calendar.
    
One room can be mapped with multiple service calendars.

outOfService.description: Indicates if the resource is out of service
Quantity of the out of service equipment.

calendarIds.description:
Service calendar IDs to be mapped with the resource.

    One equipment can only be mapped with one service calendar.
    
One room can be mapped with multiple service calendars.

templateId.description: Template ID for email notification. Not necessary for in-App notification

body.description: Body  for email notification. Not necessary for in-App notification

subject.description: Subject  for email notification. Not necessary for in-App notification

afterTime.description: Specifies the time after which the follow-up notification should be sent. This is not required for other notification types.

beforeTime.description: Specifies the time before which the reminder notification should be sent. This is not required for other notification types.

additionalEmailIds.description: Additional email addresses to receive notifications.

altType.description: Specifies the model associated with the notification. This can be extended to support additional models in the future. For now only Calendars is supported

altId.description: Specifies the ID of the model associated with the notification. This can be extended to support additional models in the future.

additionalEmailIds.description: Additional email addresses to receive notifications.

deleted.description: Marks the notification as deleted (soft delete)

body.description: Body  for email notification. Not necessary for in-App notification

subject.description: Subject  for email notification. Not necessary for in-App notification

afterTime.description: Specifies the time after which the follow-up notification should be sent.

beforeTime.description: Specifies the time before which the reminder notification should be sent.
